Class Hold

java.lang.Object
  Hold
All Implemented Interfaces:
Space
public class Hold
extends java.lang.Object
implements Space

When a token lands on a hold, they may not move again until they roll the number they rolled to land on the hold. Any other roll ends the tokenâ€™s turn without moving their token. When the token rolls the required number, they advance the number of spaces rolled times a number specified for that hold space when the board is created, which will be between two numbers set in configuration.

takeTurn

public boolean takeTurn(Token t,
                        Die d,
                        int boardEnd)
Take token's turn. Roll the die. Print the token and the roll. If the roll is equal to the token's entry roll, and if the roll times the multiplier is within the bounds of the board, advance the token.

Specified by:
takeTurn in interface Space
Parameters:
t - token that is taking its turn.
d - die that is used for the game.
boardEnd - the index of the final space on the board.
Returns:
if token has reached the final space by exact count.
